intro: Ceropegia nigeriana, commonly known as the Nigerian ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to western Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in semi-arid to tropical climates. Its flowers are usually pale green or yellowish, with a distinctive corona that attracts specific pollinators. Ceropegia nigeriana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability.
